questions.text: I have built a reputation for integrity that precedes me — people trust my word before I speak.
questions.principle: Moral capital is accumulated through consistent action

questions.text: I have relational credit built up from past faithfulness that I could draw on if needed.
My track record of keeping commitments gives me credibility when I make new ones.
I have enough moral standing that people come to me for ethical guidance or as a character reference.
My integrity has compounded over time into a genuine asset — doors open because of who I've proven to be.
